item.title: Report E-2025050468
item.description:
Report E-2025050468

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift operator was loading pallets into the trailer when the leak was discovered. The root cause of the spill is unknown. Estimated 1 gallon of paint was spilled in the trailer. Speedy dry was applied to the affected area and swept up. Damaged container and all spill clean up materials were packed into separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2025051526
item.description:
Report X-2025051526

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 16 KGS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING ELANCO CANINE PARVOVIRUS MONOCLONAL ANTIBODY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B8F499, ELANCO, 84 ZIONS VIEW RD, MANCHESTER PA 17345-9686.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Steven Hower, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1173 spill on the dock floor. Steven Hower advised while Jantzen Hutchings, 042 Checker, was unloading the freight when he punctured a drum resulting in the spill. Safety contacted CURA at 03:30 and spoke with Ariana Lopez for r emediation.

item.title: Report E-2025050158
item.description:
Report E-2025050158

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that an estimated two (2) cups of material were released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the bottom of the drum due to unloading/loading of freight. Clean Harbors removed the drum from the trailer and placed it into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The waste drum was staged onsite at the terminal. The ESTES terminal manager approved of the clean-up before Clean Harbors departed the site. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060037
item.description:
Report E-2025060037

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0156 ET, Tom Bylina with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of "Cadox M-50A" were released from a cardboard box (possibly plastic jugs inside) due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon UN3105 Cadox M-50A product released to the concrete dock floor due to forklift puncture impacting 5x5 area. The contractors broke down the pallet to remove the damaged containers and any impacted packaging material. The crew generated (2) 55-gallon poly drums and (1) 35-gallon poly drum containing the damaged plastic pails, oil dri, and impacted packaging material. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

It was discovered that a nail had punctured the bottom of the jerrican at the time the pallet was constructed. All liquid spilled evaporated before it could be cleaned up. The jerrican was placed in an overpack container and prepared for dispostion.

item.title: Report E-2025050065
item.description:
Report E-2025050065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A dock worker was loading pallets of paint into a trailer and his fork blades were tilted too far back causing them to go in between the slots on the pallet and puncture the bottom of two jerricans. Approximately 2 gallons of paint was spilled in the trailer. The spill was contained and promptly cleaned up by hazwoper trained personnel. The damaged containers and spill clean up materials were placed in separate overpack containers and prepared for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025050077
item.description:
Report E-2025050077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-28
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia employees were transferring a stretch-wrapped pallet of material from a service truck at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA. While attempting to lift the pallet, the forklift caused sudden movement of the pallet. The sudden movement of the pallet caused some of the top containers to fall impacting the floor of the service truck. Two containers leaked from their closures due to the impact. Work was stopped and the leaked material was cleaned up. The clean up debris were containerized for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050292
item.description:
Report E-2025050292

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: BIRDSBORO
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1230 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XRQ. It was reported that approximately 25 gallons of UN1760 KE-611 concentrated high alkaline detergent and smoke remover (Sodium hydroxide) released from 55-gallon poly drum due to being puncture. The release impacted trailer # 4350037. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed an approximately 25-gallons of UN1760 KE-611 released to 40x10 of wooden trailer due to a forklift puncture. The crew thoroughly cleaned impacted surfaces with granular absorbents and soda ash and tested PH neutral. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly drum, (4) 55-gallon poly drums contain neutralized impacted absorbents and pallet pieces. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050247
item.description:
Report E-2025050247

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 19:54 PM ET, BCA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Carlisle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 cups of Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate, which released from (1) 50-pound paper bag due to a forklift puncture during loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal. A contractor will be dispatched as this is a corrosive solid release. Lewis Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) cups of material was released due to forklift damaging (1) paper bag. Lewis Environmental personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only one (1) bag was damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bags and recovered material were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization for terminal personnel to manage.
